definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
to try one's luck/to leave sth to chance
to try one's luck/to rely on fate

sentences.english: He was also a reckless adventurer who got lucky.
sentences.chinese: 同时他也是一位轻率鲁莽而运气十足的冒险家。

sentences.english: But we dare not press our luck.
sentences.chinese: 但是我们不敢再碰运气了。

sentences.english: It actually took all my luck to meet you for just a moment in my lifetime.
sentences.chinese: 在有生旳瞬间遇见你，竟花光全部运气。

sentences.english: They are round and so they bring us good luck all the year round.
sentences.chinese: 它们都是圆的，能给我们带来一年的好运气。

sentences.english: Sb. could fall into shit and come up smelling of roses !
sentences.chinese: 那家伙运气特别好，掉进粪坑里还能拣个金元宝。

sentences.english: In 1768 his big chance for a major expedition came.
sentences.chinese: 1768年，他最大的运气就是主要的远征回来了。

sentences.english: To play Mah-jong well depends on both your skill and luck.
sentences.chinese: 要玩好麻将不仅要靠技术还要靠运气。

sentences.english: What do you think it takes to beat you besides luck?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得要想打败你，除了运气还需要点什么？

sentences.english: Ben:"Since Mercury10 has crossed paths with Jupiter, your fortunes are falling."
sentences.chinese: 墨丘利神已经穿过木星的轨道，你的运气正在下落。

sentences.english: One day their luck runs out.
sentences.chinese: 总有一天，他们的运气会气数已尽。

sentences.english: Explaining her success, Zhang said it had a lot to do with luck.
sentences.chinese: 谈到她的成功，张茵说这与运气有很大关系。

sentences.english: He wanted to win the horse No. 12 by straining his luck.
sentences.chinese: 他想凭他运气把赌注押在了12号马上。

sentences.english: With any luck all 3 of china's teams will be wiped out together during their training.
sentences.chinese: 运气好的话这三个表演队将会在训练中一起被摧毁。

sentences.english: Eg: I think this watch is a jinx to me.
sentences.chinese: 看来这块手表给我带来坏运气。

sentences.english: It's simply a numbers game with a little luck thrown into the mix.
sentences.chinese: 这不过是个数字游戏，一个带点小运气的排列组合。

sentences.english: But it's, I, no one ever has any luck finding a boyfriend.
sentences.chinese: 但我，没人有运气找到男朋友。

definition: to have a lucky stroke/to try one's luck
to care for/to show concern for/to think longingly (of one's country)
fate is unfavorable (idiom); the omens are not good
luck with the ladies/a romance/good luck
